entry.title: Kenya’s Revenue Authority To Track Crypto Transactions With Real-Time Tax System
entry.summary:
Kenya Revenue Authority (KRA) announced its plan to switch its outdated system to a more efficient one as part of its tax system reform. The new system, powered by emerging technologies, is set to track crypto transactions in real time to fight tax evasion and foster a “more transparent” organization.
KRA To Track Crypto Transactions In Real-Time
On Tuesday, local media outlets reported that Kenya’s revenue authority unveiled its plan to track and tax crypto transactions in the country with its new system. In a document outlining their tax collection strategies for the 2024/2025 financial year, the KRA stated that the reformed system would integrate exchanges and marketplaces to gather transaction details:
The system shall integrate with cryptocurrency exchanges and marketplaces …

entry.title: Bitcoin Open Interest Across All Exchanges Approaching All-Time High: $74,000 Incoming?
entry.summary:
Bitcoin is trading at September highs, retracing after breaking above $66,000 on October 14. Although the coin is trading lower at spot rates, the path of least resistance appears northwards, and the trend is shifting, aligning with gains of Q1 2024.
Bitcoin Open Interest Rising, Approaching $40 Billion
After months of lower lows, the world’s most valuable coin is lifting off, and with it, sentiment is improving. The latest market data shows that the Bitcoin open interest across all major derivatives exchanges is approaching all-time high.
According to Coinglass, open interest rose to over $39 billion in March 2024. As of October 15, the Bitcoin open interest is over $37.6 billion, expanding from yesterday’s $34.6 billion.
Open interest is usually used to gauge trader interes…

Bitcoin is at a critical turning point after the Federal Reserve’s interest rate cut over three weeks ago.

Key data from CryptoQuant supports this bullish outlook, revealing that new investors are starting to buy BTC again. This influx of fresh capital is a positive sign for the market and could indicate further gains as demand rises.
Historically, new investors’ accumulation periods often precede major price surges, adding to the excitement surrounding Bitcoin’s next move.
With the broader market showing signs of recovery and BTC leading the charge, the coming days will be cru…

entry.title: Tether Explores Diving Into The Commodity Trading Sector With New Lending Initiative
entry.summary:
Tether Holdings, the issuer of the world’s largest stablecoin, USDT, is reportedly exploring lending options for commodities trading companies as it seeks new ways to deploy this year’s profits amid the broader market recovery.
According to Bloomberg, the discussions involve potential US dollar lending opportunities with various firms in the commodities sector, which often grapples with access to credit.
Tether Sees New Credit Solutions For Commodity Firms
Commodity trading companies that rely heavily on credit lines, such as Trafigura Group, have large networks of lenders, with $77 billion in credit lines from about 150 institutions as of March, according to Bloomberg. By contrast, smaller companies often struggle to secure the funding they need to keep their operations running smo…

Following this initial move, the company shifted a grand total of 11,509 BTC, valued at more than $760 million, from its well-known wallets. entry.title: Dogecoin Reaching Its $80 Billion Market Cap Peak Won’t Mean A New ATH, Here’s Why
entry.summary:
In the 2021 bull run, Dogecoin hitting an $80 billion market cap marked a new all-time high (ATH) for the foremost meme coin. This time would be different if the meme coin reached this market cap, as its price would still be below its current ATH of $0.73.
Why Dogecoin Reaching An $80 Billion Market Cap Isn’t A New ATH
Dogecoin community member John Carter explained in an X post that DOGE reaching an $80 billion market won’t mark a new ATH for the meme coin primarily due to its inflationary status. The meme coin has an infinite supply, meaning that more DOGE tokens will keep entering into circulation.
This means that Dogecoin’s price will continue to be diluted as long as it doesn’t outpace the rate at which new coins are issued. In this instance, DOGE’s price has already been di…

entry.title: Crypto Scandal Erupts: Ex-Philippine Mayor Implicated In $30 Million Fraud And Laundering
entry.summary:
Have crypto fraudsters infiltrated the local government in Asia? It seems the answer is yes as information linking a former Philippine mayor to a crypto scam group operating in Asia surfaced.
This is an indicator of the growing concern about crypto scam rings in Southeast Asia and Hong Kong, which might have gained a foothold in some local governments in the region.
Recent information revealed the connection of dismissed Philippine town mayor Alice Guo to the operators of Atom Asset Exchange, a cryptocurrency enterprise that shut down after squandering millions of customer funds.
The limited regulations being imposed on the cryptocurrency in Asian markets are being exploited by crypto scammers preying on inexperienced traders who have little knowledge in navigating this intricate m…

entry.summary: Nils Anderson Röed, the exchange’s global head of financial investigations, sat down with Decrypt’s Sander Lutz at Messari Mainnet 2024 to discuss how Binance is proactively dismantling criminal networks around the world, the strategy with which the crypto exchange is approaching sensitive conflicts in the Middle East, and more.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 212 - SEEDPHRASE TALKS ART!
entry.summary: Payrolls Higher than expected, Bitcoin reacts hard. Crypto sank early in the week as Middle East tensions spooked markets. Powell signals two more rate cuts this year. SUI leads L1s again, nears YTD high despite large unlock. Majority of FTX repayments still months away. EIGEN becomes non-transferable, hits $6bn FDV. SEC to appeal Ripple securities law ruling. Visa launches tokenization platform for banks. SWIFT plans digital asset trial in 2025. ByBit launched trading of global stock indices. SPX, GIGA & FWOG hit ATHs, most memes fall. XCOPY to release 250 piece collection on Shape. HBO documentary claims to have identified Satoshi.

entry.title: Altcoins bleed, ByBit launches stock index trading, POCHITA soars
entry.summary: Altcoins sink, BTC dominance nears cycle high. BTC in ‘three blind mice’ downtrend. Tron revenue hits record $577m in Q3. ByBit to launch trading of major stock indices. Franklin Templeton launch fund on APT. SWIFT banks to trial digital assets in 2025. Aerodrome hits $1bn TVL on Base. Cronje calls out Aerodrome for copyright. ETH ICO wallet sells $47m. SEC files appeal against Ripple ruling. EIGEN falls 20% on staking rewards FUD. FTX to auction off WLD position. Half of US voters think crypto ‘important’. North Korea ‘infiltrating’ crypto industry. Snowden challenged over SOL centralisation view. Top SEC official on crypto set to depart.

entry.title: DACOM Summit: Fastex CLO Vardan Khachatryan on Crypto Compliance
entry.summary: Fastex Chief Legal Officer Vardan Khachatryan joined Rug Radio creator Mlow at DACOM Summit to discuss how the crypto exchange is advancing compliance, and the regulatory challenges that lie ahead for the sector.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 210 - MIDDLE EAST TENSIONS RISE
entry.summary: Crypto drops as Middle East tensions flare. $500m liquidations in drop. BTC ETFs see largest outflows in a month. Fidelity ETH ETF sees 2nd highest outflow ever. SUI hits 6-month highs, bridge goes live on mainnet. Hashdex set to launch XRP ETF. Wormhole leads altcoin gains after Upbit lists. BTC miners hit record low profits in September Crypto hackers stole $750m in Q3. Telegram has been disclosing IPs since 2018.

entry.title: How Arbitrum is Simplifying Web3 for Web2 Adopters
entry.summary: Arbitrum's Head of Korea, John Park, joined Rug Radio creator Pukerainbow at ArbiVerse to talk about the Ethereum layer-2's strategy in Asia, hackathons, and bringing enterprise clients to its ecosystem.

entry.title: Rep. Tom Emmer Is Confident Crypto Laws Are Coming Soon—No Matter Who Wins the Election
entry.summary: Republican Majority Whip Tom Emmer sat down with Decrypt’s Sander Lutz and Liz Napolitano to discuss the state of crypto legislation, Kamala Harris, Fairshake, and more at Messari Mainnet 2024.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 209 - LET UPTOBER BEGIN!
entry.summary: BTC ETFs see inflows for 8 straight days. SUI enters top 20, $110m of unlocks today. SOL weekly DEX volume flips ETH. Firedancer sees very fast TPS on Testnet. ETH gas up 500% in 2 weeks. EIGEN opens at $7bn FDV. FTX creditors vote in favour of restructuring plan. Dell to sell another $1.2bn Dell stock. Metaplanet buys another 107 BTC.Grayscale opens decentralised AI fund to investors. Robinhood allows crypto transfer in EU. Pollak to head Coinbase Wallet & join exec team. Gemini to close in Canada. Japan considers lower cap gains tax on crypto. Ohio bill would make it legal to pay taxes in crypto. Trump project opens whitelist to non-US users. CZ pledges to invest in blockchain companies.

entry.title: Binance CEO Richard Teng Talks Progress on Exchange's Global Regulatory Goals
entry.summary: Decrypt Reporters Sander Lutz and Liz Napolitano spoke with Binance CEO Richard Teng about the crypto exchange's progress on establishing a global headquarters, improving its relationships with regulators, and expanding its global presence in the wake of founder Changpeng "CZ" Zhao's jailing in the U.S.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 207 - WELCOME BACK TO THE BULL!
entry.summary: Kamala signals support for crypto. Top memecoins all soar, add $10bn in value in a week. MOODENG hits $180m, does 11x in a week. SUI & SEI continue to lead L1s for price & TVL growth. Revolut & Robinhood are considering stablecoin. Visa launches new tokenisation platform for banks. PayPal to allow business accounts to hold crypto Hamster kombat's HMSTER disappoints on launch. Biden admin may have forced Silvergate’s closure. Court rules crypto mining boxes ‘are securities’.
